para.dtcname: Engine Difficult to Start or Stalling

step1.ptxt: Faults and Symptoms of Common Rail Diesel Components

entry.ptxt: Decrease in performance (foreign matter is stuck)

atten4.ptxt: The maximum injection volume is controlled according to the output from the mass air flow meter.

item.ptxt: Lack of power (no black smoke) due to air filter blockage or crushed or leaking air duct
Black smoke (no lack of power) due to leakage between the turbocharger and intake manifold
Air leak in the turbocharged air passage
ECM not operating well
Turbocharger (turbine, bearing)

entry.ptxt: Lack of power (when vehicle is starting, under heavy load)
(Black smoke is not emitted when racing while vehicle is stopped)

item.ptxt: With the ignition switch ON or during idling, MAP = atmospheric pressure (standard atmospheric pressure = 101 kPa). When the engine speed is about 1500 rpm or more, the turbocharger starts to take effect and MAP becomes higher than atmospheric pressure.
Atmospheric pressure decreases by 1 kPa each time elevation increases by 100 m, and is also affected by the current weather conditions.

entry.ptxt: Lack of power (high engine speed, under heavy load)
Difficult to start, rough idle, knocking, white smoke (when cold)

item.ptxt: Measure the resistance of the glow plug
Check the glow plug indicator light

entry.ptxt: Difficult to start (cannot crank, crank speed is low), horn is quiet

item.ptxt: When cranking, battery voltage is below 5 V.

entry.ptxt: Cannot crank, crank speed is low, strange noise

item.ptxt: When cranking during the "Check the Cylinder Compression" Active Test, if there is a high speed cylinder, approx. 100 rpm more than the other cylinders, that cylinder may lose compression.
When an Injector Feedback Val is more than 3 mm3/st, there may be a malfunction in the corresponding cylinder.
Ignition switch (STA) output:
ON: Starter assembly is operating
OFF: Starter assembly is not operating

entry.ptxt: Difficult to start, engine stalling, rough idle, lack of power
Fuel Press, Target Common Rail Pressure

item.ptxt: Fuel Press is within 5000 kPa of Target Common Rail Pressure during idling with the engine warmed up (engine coolant temperature is higher than 75째C (167째F)).
If the fuel pressure is 20000 kPa below the target pressure, then a lack of power will be felt.
If the fuel pressure is below 25000 kPa, then idling will be rough.
The fuel pressure changes at engine start, but is approx. 25000 kPa at engine start after the engine is warmed up.
When Target Pump SCV Current is 3000 mA or higher, the suction control valve has a tendency to become stuck.

entry.ptxt: Even if Fuel Press is below Target Common Rail Pressure, a DTC will not be stored.
Difficult to start, engine stalling, rough idle, lack of power
Fuel Press, Target Common Rail Pressure

item.ptxt: Fuel Press is within 5000 kPa of Target Common Rail Pressure during idling with the engine warmed up (engine coolant temperature is higher than 75째C (167째F)).
If the fuel pressure is 20000 kPa below the target pressure, then a lack of power will be felt.
If the fuel pressure is below 25000 kPa, then idling will be rough.

atten4.ptxt: The fuel pressure changes at engine start, but is approx. 25000 kPa at engine start after the engine is warmed up.

entry.ptxt: Even if Fuel Press is below Target Common Rail Pressure, a DTC will not be stored.
Rough idle, lack of power, black smoke, white smoke, knocking

item.ptxt: When an Injector Feedback Val is more than 3 mm3/st, there may be a malfunction in the corresponding cylinder. This value can be read after idling for 1 minute.

entry.ptxt: Circuit fault: The fuel injector does not open.
Difficult to start, rough idle, lack of power, black smoke, white smoke, knocking
When the injector driver has a fault, some DTCs may be stored.
Open circuit, decrease in performance (foreign matter is stuck)
Difficult to start, rough idle, engine stall, lack of power
Fuel Press, Target Common Rail Pressure

item.ptxt: Slowly raise the engine speed from idling to 3000 rpm with the vehicle stopped and check that Fuel Press follows Target Common Rail Pressure. If the fuel pressure sensor malfunctions, the actual fuel pressure may deviate from the target fuel pressure (either Fuel Press decreases to a value less than Target Common Rail Pressure).

entry.ptxt: When the fuel pressure sensor has a fault, some DTCs may be stored.
Difficult to start, rough idle (especially when cold)

item.ptxt: Stuck closed: Lack of power, difficult to start, rough idle, engine stall, black smoke. These may occur when stuck almost fully closed.
Stuck open: Turbocharger sound increases. When the engine is stopped, engine vibrations may occur.

entry.ptxt: Actual Throttle Position, Actual Throttle Position #2

item.ptxt: 100%: Fully closed
0%: Fully open

When the ignition switch to ON (the engine is stopped), the diesel throttle is fully open. When idling, the diesel throttle is at the halfway point. When the ignition switch is turned from ON to off, the throttle is fully closed temporarily.

step1.ptxt: Data List Related to Starting Trouble

item.ptxt: MAP
MAF
Intake Air
Coolant Temp
Battery Voltage
Starter Signal
Engine Speed of Cyl #1 (to #8)
(Output only when the "Check the Cylinder Compression" Active Test is performed)
Target Common Rail Pressure
Fuel Press
Target Pump SCV Current
Injection Feedback Val #1 (to #8)
Injection Volume
Actual Throttle Position
Actual Throttle Position #2

entry.ptxt: For good starting it is essential to have:

item.ptxt: Sufficient cranking speed.
Properly operating engine preheating system.
Good quality fuel.

entry.ptxt: The fuel is ignited by the heat which is generated by compression pressure.

With problems such as a depleted battery, the crankshaft speed can become low, or if the engine compression is poor due to leakage, the compression pressure will not rise and there will be difficulty starting.

When the engine is cold, even if there is compression heat, it will escape from the combustion chamber. For this reason, when the engine is started when it is cold, the glow plugs heat the compressed air.

Also, after starting the engine, by charging the glow plugs for a fixed time set according to the engine coolant temperature, diesel knocking and white smoke are prevented. The quantity of fuel injected is determined by the fuel pressure and also the amount of time the fuel injector is open.

step1.ptxt: Trouble Area Chart According to Problem Cause

item.ptxt: After replacing the ECM, the new ECM needs registration (Click here ) and initialization (Click here ).
After replacing the fuel supply pump assembly, the ECM needs initialization.
Click here
After replacing an fuel injector, the ECM needs registration (Click here ).

atten4.ptxt: Specified values in the following troubleshooting flowchart are for reference only. Variations in the Data List values may occur depending on the measuring conditions or the vehicle age. Do not assume the vehicle is normal when the Data List outputs standard values. There may be concealed factors of the malfunction.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK ENGINE CRANKING CONDITION

test1.ptxt: Check the engine cranking condition.

atten4.ptxt: When the cranking speed is low, especially when the temperature is low, check if the engine oil grade matches the recommendation.

testgrp.testtitle: READ ALL OUTPUT DTCS

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: System Select / Health Check.
Check the DTCs.

atten4.ptxt: If only DTC P1604 is output, proceed to step 3.

testgrp.testtitle: TAKE SNAPSHOT DURING STARTING AND IDLING (PROCEDURE 3)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Diesel Starting.
Take a snapshot when idling with no load after the engine is warmed up and when starting trouble is occurring.

item.ptxt: A snapshot can be used to compare vehicle data from the time of the malfunction to normal data and is very useful for troubleshooting.

When there is trouble starting with a cold engine, take the snapshot when the engine is cold. Then warm up the engine (engine coolant temperature is 75째C (167째F) or higher) and after idling the vehicle for 1 minute (A/C off, electrical load off), take a snapshot of the data for 15 seconds while idling.

Take a snapshot when the problem is occurring, such as when the engine is cold. However, if the problem does not reoccur, it is acceptable to only take a snapshot after the engine is warmed up and when the engine is started.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK SNAPSHOT (FUEL PRESS)

test1.ptxt: Check Fuel Press in the snapshot taken in procedure 3 when the engine was started.

entry.ptxt: At the point in the illustration labeled "a", Fuel Press is less than 10000 kPa from the value of Fuel Press when cranking started
At the point in the illustration labeled "c", Fuel Press is below Target Common Rail Pressure by 15000 kPa or more

Fuel Press increases to a value that is higher than Target Common Rail Pressure immediately after cranking, and, at the point in the illustration labeled "d", Fuel Press is higher than Target Common Rail Pressure

item.ptxt: Even if Fuel Press is temporarily higher than Target Common Rail Pressure, as shown at the point in the illustration labeled "b", the fuel supply pump assembly is normal.
Fuel pressure is about 25000 to 35000 kPa when the engine is cranking and the engine coolant temperature is 0째C (32째F) or higher.
Fuel Press increases rapidly during cranking.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK IF FUEL IS BEING SUPPLIED TO FUEL SUPPLY PUMP ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the inlet hose from the fuel supply pump assembly.
Operate the priming pump and check that fuel is being supplied to the fuel supply pump assembly.

specitem.ptxt: Fuel is properly supplied to the fuel supply pump assembly when the priming pump is operated.

item.ptxt: When there is a lack of fuel, fuel pressure drops.
Inspect for fuel filter element assembly clogging (check that the fuel filter element assembly is not clogged).

test1.ptxt: Reconnect the inlet hose.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK HARNESS AND CONNECTOR (SUCTION CONTROL VALVE - ECM)

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the suction control valve connector.
Disconnect the ECM connector.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.

entry.ptxt: r2-1 (+B) or C39-106 (PCV+) - Body ground and other terminals
r2-2 (PCV) or C39-105 (PCV-) - Body ground and other terminals

test1.ptxt: Reconnect the suction control valve connector.
Reconnect the ECM connector.

action.actiontitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE HARNESS OR CONNECTOR

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE FUEL SUPPLY PUMP ASSEMBLY (SUCTION CONTROL VALVE)

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel supply pump assembly.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: BLEED AIR FROM FUEL SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM FUEL SUPPLY PUMP INITIALIZATION

test1.ptxt: Perform fuel supply pump initialization.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (FUEL PRESS)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Fuel Press.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Start the engine.
Read the values while cranking and idling the engine.

entry.ptxt: The engine cannot be started or the engine can be started but Fuel Press is below 20000 kPa 2 seconds after the starter signal changes from OFF to ON

testgrp.testtitle: INSPECT FUEL INJECTOR (INSPECTION FOR VALVE CLOSING PROBLEM)

test1.ptxt: Remove the glow plug for all the cylinders.
Click here
Visually check if there is fuel on the glow plugs.

item.ptxt: If there is fuel on a glow plug, fuel may be leaking from an fuel injector.
After replacing an fuel injector, make sure that the Fuel Press (fuel pressure) is within 5000 kPa of the target fuel pressure while cranking the engine.

If there is fuel on a glow plug, fuel may have mixed with the engine oil. Check the engine oil amount and whether the engine oil smells of diesel fuel. If the oil level is above the full line or the engine oil smells of diesel fuel, replace the engine oil.

test1.ptxt: Install the glow plug.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK AND REPAIR OR REPLACE CLOGGED FUEL PIPE (INCLUDING FROZEN FUEL) (FUEL TANK - FUEL SUPPLY PUMP ASSEMBLY)

test1.ptxt: Check and repair or replace the clogged fuel pipe.

testgrp.testtitle: BLEED AIR FROM FUEL SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (FUEL PRESS)

test1.ptxt: Check Fuel Press in the snapshot taken in procedure 3 when the engine was warmed up.

entry.ptxt: Difference between Fuel Press and Target Common Rail Pressure is 5000 kPa (51.0 kgf/cm2, 725 psi) or more

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE FUEL SUPPLY PUMP ASSEMBLY (SUCTION CONTROL VALVE)

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel supply pump assembly.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM FUEL SUPPLY PUMP INITIALIZATION

test1.ptxt: Perform fuel supply pump initialization.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE FUEL INJECTORS OF ALL CYLINDERS

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel injectors of all cylinders.
Click here

item.ptxt: When replacing the fuel injector for a cylinder, always be sure to use a new injection pipe.

Follow the procedure in the repair manual and temporarily install the No. 1 injection pipe sub-assembly, No. 2 injection pipe sub-assembly and No. 1 nozzle leakage pipe assembly, and then correctly position the injector assemblies. After that, tighten parts according to the torque specifications.
If the installation procedure is not performed correctly, injector assemblies may become out of position, which may cause the injector assemblies to deteriorate, resulting in malfunctions.
If an fuel injector deteriorates and malfunctions, other problems such as knocking, rough idle, etc. may occur.
If an fuel injector becomes out of position, it is possible that the seal between the fuel injector and injection pipe sub-assembly may become incomplete, resulting in a fuel leak.

testgrp.testtitle: INSPECT INJECTOR DRIVER

test1.ptxt: Even in cases where DTC P062D and P062E are not stored even though the engine cannot be started, perform the DTC P062D troubleshooting procedure.
Click here

item.ptxt: When the engine cannot be started due to a malfunction in the injector driver system, once the DTCs are cleared, the system cannot store DTC P062D and P062E even if it is confirmed that the engine cannot be started when trying to reproduce the problem symptoms.

As DTC P062D and P062E cannot be stored when starting the engine, fuel injection signals are output by the ECM, but fuel is not actually injected. Therefore, an excessive amount of fuel is supplied to the common rail by the fuel supply pump assembly, and as a result, the fuel pressure is higher than the target common rail pressure in the data recorded at the time the engine was having trouble starting.

If the problem cannot be determined even after performing the DTC P062D and P062E troubleshooting procedure and the fuel pressure is higher than the target common rail pressure when attempting to start the engine, proceed to the next step.

testgrp.testtitle: INSPECT FUEL INJECTOR

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the injector assembly connectors.
Measure the resistance of the injector assembly.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK DATA LIST (INJECTOR FEEDBACK VAL #1 TO #8 AND INJECTION VOLUME)

test1.ptxt: Check Injection Feedback Val # in the snapshot taken in procedure 3 when the engine was idling.

entry.ptxt: Injection Feedback Val #1 to #8 are 3 mm3/st or less.
Injection Volume is more than 10 mm3/st.
Injection Feedback Val for at least one cylinder is more than +3 mm3/st

atten4.ptxt: There may be a malfunction in the corresponding cylinder.

item.ptxt: *: When this case occurs, usually symptoms may be noticeable, such as difficulty starting, lack of power.
The shift lever should be in neutral and the A/C switch and all accessory switches should be off.

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE FUEL INJECTORS OF ALL CYLINDERS

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel injectors of all cylinders.
Click here

item.ptxt: When replacing the fuel injector for a cylinder, always be sure to use a new injection pipe.

Follow the procedure in the repair manual and temporarily install the No. 1 injection pipe sub-assembly, No. 2 injection pipe sub-assembly and No. 1 nozzle leakage pipe assembly, and then correctly position the injector assemblies. After that, tighten parts according to the torque specifications.
If the installation procedure is not performed correctly, injector assemblies may become out of position, which may cause the injector assemblies to deteriorate, resulting in malfunctions.
If an fuel injector deteriorates and malfunctions, other problems such as knocking, rough idle, etc. may occur.
If an fuel injector becomes out of position, it is possible that the seal between the fuel injector and injection pipe sub-assembly may become incomplete, resulting in a fuel leak.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (CHECK THE CYLINDER COMPRESSION)

atten4.ptxt: Use this Active Test to help determine whether a cylinder has compression loss or not.

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Check the Cylinder Compression / Data List / Compression / Engine Speed of Cyl #1 to #8.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

test1.ptxt: Check the engine speed during the Active Test.

entry.ptxt: The values of Engine Speed Cyl #1 to #8 are within 10 rpm of each other.

atten4.ptxt: When cranking, if the speed of a cylinder is approximately 100 rpm more than the other cylinders, there is probably a complete loss of compression in that cylinder.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK CYLINDER COMPRESSION PRESSURE OF MALFUNCTIONING CYLINDER

atten4.ptxt: Measure the compression of the cylinder that had a high speed during the "Check the Cylinder Compression" Active Test.

test1.ptxt: Check the cylinder compression pressure.
Click here

action.actiontitle: CHECK ENGINE TO DETERMINE CAUSE OF LOW COMPRESSION

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE FUEL INJECTOR OF MALFUNCTIONING CYLINDER

atten4.ptxt: It can be determined that the fuel injector is faulty as the corresponding cylinder is malfunctioning, but has no compression loss.

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel injector of malfunctioning cylinder.
Click here

item.ptxt: When replacing the fuel injector for a cylinder, always be sure to use a new injection pipe.

Follow the procedure in the repair manual and temporarily install the No. 1 injection pipe sub-assembly, No. 2 injection pipe sub-assembly and No. 1 nozzle leakage pipe assembly, and then correctly position the injector assemblies. After that, tighten parts according to the torque specifications.
If the installation procedure is not performed correctly, injector assemblies may become out of position, which may cause the injector assemblies to deteriorate, resulting in malfunctions.
If an fuel injector deteriorates and malfunctions, other problems such as knocking, rough idle, etc. may occur.
If an fuel injector becomes out of position, it is possible that the seal between the fuel injector and injection pipe sub-assembly may become incomplete, resulting in a fuel leak.

testgrp.testtitle: CLEAN FUEL FILTER CASE AND REPLACE FUEL FILTER ELEMENT ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Clean the fuel filter case and replace the fuel filter element assembly.

atten4.ptxt: Be sure to clean the inside of the fuel filter case as the injector assemblies may not operate properly if the fuel filter is installed with foreign matter remaining inside the fuel filter case.

testgrp.testtitle: BLEED AIR FROM FUEL SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: REGISTER INJECTOR COMPENSATION CODE

test1.ptxt: Register the injector compensation codes.

testgrp.testtitle: CONFIRM WHETHER MALFUNCTION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY REPAIRED
CHECK TEMPERATURE WHEN STARTING TROUBLE OCCURS

test1.ptxt: Check the temperature when starting trouble occurs.

entry.ptxt: Difficult to start only for cold engine.
Difficult to start both for cold and warmed up engine.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (COOLANT TEMP)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Difficult to start / Coolant Temp.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read the value displayed on the GTS.

specitem.ptxt: Coolant Temp is not high when the engine is cold, and not low after the engine is warmed up

testgrp.testtitle: INSPECT GLOW PLUG (RESISTANCE)

test1.ptxt: Inspect the glow plug.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK FUEL QUALITY

test1.ptxt: Check that only diesel fuel is being used.
Check that the fuel does not contain any impurities.

testgrp.testtitle: READ OUTPUT DTC (RELATED TO ENGINE)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.
Read the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK COMMUNICATION BETWEEN GTS AND ECM

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Check if the normal starting screen appears (check whether communication with the ECM is possible).

atten4.ptxt: Use a GTS that is able to communicate with other vehicles.

specitem.ptxt: Communication is possible (vehicle can be recognized).

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (STARTER SIGNAL AND CLUTCH SWITCH)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Primary / Starter Signal and Clutch Switch.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read the value displayed on the GTS.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK STARTING SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Inspect the starting system.

atten4.ptxt: Be sure to inspect the following areas:

item.ptxt: Battery
Starter relay
Starter assembly
Immobiliser system

testgrp.testtitle: CONFIRM WHETHER MALFUNCTION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY REPAIRED
